intro: Secamone delagoensis, commonly known as the African secamone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The fruit is a capsule that releases small seeds when mature.
